Based on [[Mach]] and [[FreeBSD]],<ref>[http://english.peopledaily.com.cn/200606/17/eng20060617_275003.html China Peoples Daily ''(Retrieved 13 May 2009)'']</ref> it aims to add an extra level of security to that operating system. +
'''Kylin''' ({{zh|s=éºéº}}) is an [[operating system]] developed by academics at the [[National University of Defense Technology]] in the [[People's Republic of China]], and approved for use by the [[People's Liberation Army]]. Based on [[Mach (kernel)|Mach]] and [[FreeBSD]],<ref>[http://english.peopledaily.com.cn/200606/17/eng20060617_275003.html China Peoples Daily ''(Retrieved 13 May 2009)'']</ref> it aims to add an extra level of security to that operating system. In this sense, it is a similar effort to [[Selinux|Security-Enhanced Linux]] that is primarily developed by the U.S. [[National Security Agency]]. The first public version of Kylin was released in 2007.<ref>[http://www.kylin.org.cn Kylin Homepage ''(Retrieved 15 May 2009)'']</ref>
The Kylin system, as a version of the FreeBSD UNIX-based operating system, is compatible with other mainstream operating systems and supports multiple microprocessors and computers of different structures.
The Kylin system, as a version of the FreeBSD UNIX-based operating system, is compatible with other mainstream operating systems and supports multiple microprocessors and computers of different structures.
